etymology.description: 欺(欺) (qī, "deceive") + 负(負) (fù, "bear; suffer") is interpreted as causing someone to suffer through deceptive or harmful actions, which aligns with the concept of bullying.
etymology.interpretation: 欺负(欺負) (qīfu, "bully") combines the ideas of deceit and causing someone to bear suffering, representing the unfair and harmful behavior typical of bullying.

examples.chinese: 他欺负同学(他欺負同學)。
小明欺负同学(小明欺負同學)，结果被老师批评(結果被老師批評)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎomíng qīfù tóngxué, jiéguǒ bèi lǎoshī pīpíng.
examples.english: Xiaoming bullies his classmates, and as a result, he was criticized by the teacher.
